title: Aloo Chop
instructions: Mash the boiled potatoes and mix with chopped onion, green chilies, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Shape the mixture into small round patties.
Make a batter with gram flour, water, and a pinch of salt.
Dip each patty into the batter and coat evenly.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crisp.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Mochar Chop
ingredients: 1 cup banana flower (mocha, cleaned and boiled)
instructions: Mash the banana flower with mashed potatoes, add ginger paste, garam masala, and salt.
Form small cutlet-shaped chops.
Make a batter with gram flour and water.
Dip each chop in the batter, roll in bread crumbs.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with mustard sauce or kasundi.

title: Ghugni with Luchi
instructions: Boil soaked white peas until soft.
In a pan, sauté onion, ginger paste, turmeric, cumin, tomato, and peas until well combined.
Add salt and garam masala, cook until thick.
For luchi, knead flour with ghee and water into a dough.
Make small balls and roll out into circles.
Deep fry until puffed and golden.
Serve hot with ghugni.

title: Luchi with Aloo Dum
instructions: Make dough with flour, ghee, and water. Rest 20 mins.
Roll into small circles and deep fry luchis.
For aloo dum, sauté onion, ginger, turmeric, cumin, tomato.
Add boiled potatoes and salt, cook until coated.
Serve hot aloo dum with luchi.

title: Vegetable Chop
instructions: Boil and mash vegetables. Mix with onion, spices, and salt.
Shape into cutlets.
Dip in gram flour batter, coat with bread crumbs.
Deep fry until crispy.
Serve with kasundi or chutney.

title: Chire Bhaja (Fried Poha)
instructions: Heat oil, fry peanuts and red chili.
Add poha and turmeric, sauté until crisp.
Season with salt and mix well.
Serve as a crunchy snack.

title: Chirer Pulao
instructions: Wash poha and drain.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, then onion and chili.
Add potato and turmeric, cook until soft.
Add poha, salt, and mix well.
Cook for 2-3 mins and serve hot.

title: Chhanar Dalna with Roti
instructions: Make dough with flour and water, set aside.
Fry chhena pieces and potato cubes till golden.
Sauté cumin seeds, ginger paste, tomato, turmeric.
Add potatoes and chhena, cook with water until gravy forms.
Roll dough into rotis and cook on tawa.
Serve chhanar dalna with roti.

title: Jhalmuri
instructions: In a bowl, mix puffed rice, onion, chili, and potato.
Add mustard oil, lemon juice, cumin powder, and salt.
Toss well and serve immediately.

title: Telebhaja
ingredients: 1 cup assorted vegetables (onion rings, eggplant, potato slices)
instructions: Make a thick batter with besan, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and water.
Dip vegetable slices in the batter.
Deep fry in hot oil until crispy and golden.
Serve hot with puffed rice or tea.

title: Koraishutir Kochuri
instructions: Make a dough with flour, salt, and water. Let it rest for 30 minutes.
Grind boiled peas with ginger and spices into a coarse paste.
Sauté the paste in oil till moisture evaporates.
Make small balls from the dough and stuff with the pea filling.
Roll out and deep fry till golden.
Serve hot with aloo dum or chutney.

title: Dal Puri
instructions: Cook chana dal until soft and mash with cumin and asafoetida.
Knead flour with water and salt to form dough.
Divide dough, stuff with dal mixture, and roll into puris.
Deep fry until golden and puffed.
Serve hot with pickle or curry.

title: Cholar Dal with Luchi
instructions: Boil chana dal with turmeric until soft.
Temper with cumin, bay leaf, and coconut.
Simmer dal and adjust seasoning.
Make luchi dough with flour and water.
Roll and deep fry the luchis until puffed.
Serve hot together.

title: Kachauri with Sabzi
instructions: Soak and grind moong dal with spices.
Cook dal filling until dry.
Make dough, stuff with dal, roll and deep fry.
Cook sabzi with cumin, turmeric, and potatoes.
Serve hot kachauri with spicy sabzi.

title: Aloo Paratha (Bihari Style)
instructions: Make dough with flour and water.
Mix mashed potatoes with ajwain, chili, mustard oil, and salt.
Stuff and roll out parathas.
Cook on tawa with ghee until golden brown.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

title: Thekua
instructions: Melt jaggery with water and mix with flour, coconut, ghee, and cardamom.
Make a stiff dough and shape into flat discs.
Deep fry till golden and crisp.
Cool and store in airtight container.

title: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Make dough using flour and water.
Sauté vegetables with garlic, soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Roll dough, fill with veg mixture, and shape momos.
Steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve with spicy chutney.

title: Patishapta (Sweet Tiffin)
instructions: Mix flour, semolina, rice flour with milk to make batter.
Cook coconut and jaggery with cardamom for filling.
Pour batter on pan, make thin crepe.
Place filling and roll.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Suji Halwa with Poori
instructions: Roast suji in ghee until golden.
Add hot water, stir continuously to avoid lumps.
Add sugar and cardamom, mix until thickened.
Make dough with wheat flour and water, roll pooris.
Deep fry pooris until puffed.
Serve halwa hot with pooris.

title: Khichdi with Beguni
instructions: Roast dal, then cook with rice, turmeric, salt, and bay leaf.
Make batter with besan, salt, and water.
Dip eggplant slices and deep fry till crispy.
Serve hot khichdi with beguni on the side.

title: Pakhala Bhata
ingredients: Yogurt or fried vegetables (optional, for serving)
instructions: Cool the cooked rice and mix it with water in a bowl.
Add salt and slit green chili to the mixture.
Let it sit for 4-5 hours or overnight.
Drizzle mustard oil over the rice before serving.
Serve with yogurt or fried vegetables.

title: Vegetable Ghugni
instructions: Pressure cook soaked peas and potatoes until soft.
Heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger paste, turmeric, cumin, and garam masala.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add the peas and potato mixture and mix well.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes and serve hot.

title: Sabudana Vada (East Style)
instructions: Mix soaked sabudana with mashed potato, peanuts, green chili, and salt.
Shape into small round patties.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the vadas until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Matar Pulao
instructions: Rinse and soak rice for 30 minutes.
Heat oil/ghee, add spices and cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add green peas and rice. Stir for 2 minutes.
Add water and salt. Cook until rice is done.
Fluff and serve hot.

title: Doodh Puli
instructions: Boil coconut and jaggery to make a filling.
Knead rice flour with warm water to make dough.
Stuff coconut-jaggery mixture into small dough balls and shape into pulis.
Boil milk and add pulis. Simmer until soft.
Add cardamom powder and serve warm.

title: Sattu Paratha
instructions: Make a soft dough from wheat flour and water.
Mix sattu, chili, ajwain, coriander, mustard oil, and salt for the stuffing.
Roll dough, stuff with sattu mix, and seal.
Roll into paratha and cook with ghee on tawa.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

title: Sattu Sandwich
instructions: Mix sattu with chili, onion, lemon juice, and salt.
Spread mixture on a bread slice, top with another slice.
Apply butter on both sides and toast until golden.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Dahi Chura
instructions: Wash and soak flattened rice briefly.
Drain water and mix with curd and sugar.
Top with banana slices if desired.
Serve immediately.

title: Fried Flattened Rice
instructions: Wash and drain flattened rice.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, onions, and green chili.
Add turmeric and salt, then the poha.
Mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Dhokla (Bihari Style)
instructions: Mix besan, turmeric, sugar, salt, lemon juice, and water to make batter.
Add eno and mix well. Pour into greased plate.
Steam for 15-20 mins. Cool and cut into pieces.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, and pour over dhokla.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

title: Labra with Luchi
instructions: Knead dough with flour, salt, and water. Rest for 20 mins.
Heat oil, add panch phoron, add chopped vegetables.
Add turmeric and salt, cook covered till soft.
Mash slightly to combine flavors.
Roll luchis and deep fry until puffed.
Serve hot with labra.

title: Baiguni with Rice
instructions: Wash and cook rice.
Make a batter with besan, turmeric, chili, and salt.
Dip eggplant slices in batter and deep fry until crispy.
Serve hot baiguni with steamed rice and dal.

title: Samosa (Singara)
instructions: Prepare dough with flour, salt, and water.
Sauté cumin, add potatoes, peas, and spices.
Make small dough balls, roll and stuff with filling.
Shape into samosas and deep fry till golden.
Serve with chutney or tea.

title: Chana Dal Pancakes
instructions: Grind soaked dal with chili and ginger into a paste.
Add onion, turmeric, salt, and mix.
Pour batter onto hot greased pan, spread evenly.
Cook on both sides till golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Sooji Pithas
instructions: Make a thick dough with suji and water.
Prepare filling with jaggery, coconut, and cardamom.
Shape small balls, flatten and fill with coconut mix.
Seal and shape as desired, steam or fry.
Serve warm as a festive treat.

title: Vegetable Maggi (Odia street-style)
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onion, chili, and vegetables.
Add water, noodles, and taste-maker.
Cook till noodles are soft and water is absorbed.
Serve hot with ketchup or green chutney.

title: Bihari Litti (Dry Style)
instructions: Make stiff dough with flour, salt, and water.
Mix sattu with mustard oil, spices, and salt for stuffing.
Shape littis with stuffing inside.
Bake or roast on tandoor or oven till golden.
Serve with chutney or chokha.

title: Besan Chilla (Eastern Style)
instructions: Mix besan, water, onion, chili, turmeric, and salt to make batter.
Pour batter onto hot tawa, spread evenly.
Cook till golden on both sides using a little oil.
Serve with ketchup or mint chutney.

title: Coconut Rice (Odia Style)
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chili.
Add coconut and sauté lightly.
Mix in cooked rice and salt.
Stir well and serve hot with pickle or raita.

title: Cabbage Cutlet
instructions: Mix cabbage, potato, chili, garam masala, salt, and bread crumbs.
Shape into small cutlets.
Shallow fry until golden on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

title: Tomato Chutney with Puri
instructions: Heat oil and temper mustard seeds.
Add chopped onion, chilies, and tomatoes.
Cook till soft and mushy, add salt and turmeric.
Make dough with wheat flour and water.
Roll into small discs and deep fry to make puris.
Serve puris hot with tomato chutney.

title: Samosa-Chana Combo
instructions: Prepare or buy samosas.
Mix boiled chickpeas with chopped onion, tomato, salt, and chaat masala.
Serve samosas topped with chana, green and tamarind chutneys.

title: Flattened Rice Kheer
instructions: Boil milk and add washed flattened rice.
Cook till soft and add sugar and cardamom.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes, garnish with nuts.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Chhena Poda
instructions: Mash chhena, add sugar, semolina, and cardamom.
Pour mixture into greased tin, top with nuts.
Bake at 180°C for 30–40 minutes until golden.
Cool and serve sliced.

title: Dalma with Roti
instructions: Pressure cook dal and vegetables with turmeric and salt.
Temper with panch phoron and dry red chilies.
Mash lightly and serve hot.
Prepare roti with wheat flour dough and roast.
Serve dalma with hot rotis.

title: Matar Kachori
instructions: Make stuffing with mashed peas, spices, and salt.
Prepare dough with flour and water.
Stuff dough with peas mix, roll and deep fry.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Spinach Puri
instructions: Mix spinach puree with flour, salt, and carom seeds.
Make a tight dough, roll into small discs.
Deep fry until puffed and golden.
Serve with curd or chutney.

title: Vegetable Handvo
instructions: Mix flour, bottle gourd, curd, and spices to make a batter.
Temper mustard and sesame seeds in a pan.
Pour batter and cook covered till golden and crisp.
Serve sliced with chutney.

title: Puffed Rice Upma
instructions: Soak puffed rice and squeeze out water.
Heat oil, temper mustard seeds, sauté onion and chili.
Add puffed rice and salt, mix well.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Green Gram Pitha
instructions: Cook green gram and mash with jaggery and cardamom.
Make dough with rice flour and water.
Stuff with green gram mix and shape into pithas.
Steam or fry till done.
Serve warm as a sweet tiffin.

title: Egg Curry with Luchi
instructions: Boil eggs and keep aside. Prepare a spicy curry using onions, tomatoes, and spices. Add boiled eggs and cook for 5-7 minutes. Serve hot with luchi.

title: Egg Roll (Kolkata Style)
instructions: Fry paratha and cook beaten egg on it. Add onions and sauces, then roll it tightly. Wrap in paper and serve hot.

title: Egg Devil Chop
instructions: Wrap half a boiled egg in spiced mashed potato, coat in breadcrumbs, and deep fry until golden. Serve with chutney.

title: Egg Cutlet
instructions: Mash eggs with potatoes, onions, and spices. Shape into cutlets, coat in breadcrumbs, and shallow fry until crisp.

title: Egg Ghugni
instructions: Cook yellow peas in spiced onion gravy. Add boiled or fried eggs and simmer. Serve hot with puffed rice or roti.

title: Anda Tarkari with Paratha
instructions: Make a spicy tomato-onion based curry and add boiled eggs. Simmer and serve with freshly made paratha.

title: Boiled Egg Sandwich
instructions: Chop boiled eggs and mix with mayo and seasoning. Spread on bread with lettuce to make sandwiches.

title: Egg Masala with Chire Bhaja
instructions: Prepare spicy egg masala and serve with crispy roasted flattened rice (chire bhaja).

title: Scrambled Egg with Litti
instructions: Make scrambled eggs with onions and mustard oil. Serve with hot litti as a hearty tiffin.

title: Egg Pakhala
instructions: Soak cooked rice in water and curd, season lightly, and serve with boiled eggs. A refreshing summer tiffin.

title: Anda Tadka with Roti
instructions: Heat oil, splutter cumin seeds, add onion and green chilies.
Sauté till translucent, then add tomatoes and turmeric.
Add cooked moong dal and mix well.
Crack eggs directly into the mixture and scramble everything together.
Cook until eggs are done and mixed with dal.
Serve hot with fresh rotis.

title: Omelette with Luchi
instructions: Beat eggs with onion, chili, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil and cook the omelette on both sides until done.
Knead flour with water and salt to make luchi dough.
Roll and deep fry luchis until puffed and golden.
Serve hot omelette with freshly fried luchis.

title: Dimer Jhol
instructions: Boil and peel the eggs, then lightly fry them and the potatoes.
Heat mustard oil, add onion, sauté till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, spices, tomato and cook till mushy.
Add fried eggs and potatoes, coat with masala.
Add water and simmer until potatoes are cooked.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Egg Biryani (Light)
ingredients: Whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon)
instructions: Cook rice till 90% done, drain and keep aside.
Heat oil, fry whole spices, then sauté onions till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, tomato, and yogurt. Cook till thick.
Add garam masala and halved eggs, mix well.
Layer rice and egg mixture in a pot. Cover and cook on low heat for 10 mins.
Serve hot with raita.

title: Anda Pulao
instructions: Boil and slice the eggs.
Wash and soak rice for 15 minutes.
Heat oil, sauté cumin, onion, chili, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add spices and rice, stir for 2 mins.
Add water, cook covered until rice is done.
Garnish with egg slices and serve hot.

title: Chicken Roll (Kolkata Style)
instructions: Cook the chicken with spices and shred it.
Beat the egg and fry each paratha with the egg coating.
Place chicken, onion, chutney, and chaat masala over the paratha.
Roll it tightly and serve hot.

title: Mutton Kasha with Luchi
instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt and spices for 1 hour.
Cook onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes until soft.
Add marinated mutton and cook until tender.
Serve hot with luchi.

title: Chicken Cutlet
instructions: Mix chicken, onion, chilies, and spices.
Shape into cutlets, dip in beaten egg and coat with breadcrumbs.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with ketchup.

title: Fish Fry with Ghugni
instructions: Boil soaked peas and cook with spices to make ghugni.
Marinate fish with spices and fry until golden.
Serve fish fry hot with a bowl of ghugni.

title: Egg-Chicken Roll
instructions: Cook parathas with egg coating.
Stuff with chicken, onion, chutney, and masala.
Roll tightly and serve hot.

title: Mutton Ghugni
instructions: Boil peas and cook mutton with spices.
Mix cooked peas and mutton, simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with bread or luchi.

title: Fish Chop
instructions: Mix fish with mashed potato, onion, and spices.
Shape into chops, coat with egg and breadcrumbs.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve with mustard sauce.

title: Chicken Devil
instructions: Mix chicken with spices, shape into ovals.
Dip in egg and roll in breadcrumbs.
Deep fry until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney.

title: Mutton Stuffed Paratha
instructions: Knead dough with flour and water.
Stuff with spiced mutton mixture.
Roll and cook on tawa with oil/ghee.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Chicken Keema Sandwich
instructions: Cook keema with onions and spices.
Spread on buttered bread slices.
Grill or toast until crisp.
Serve with ketchup.

title: Fish Curry with Rice Cake
instructions: Prepare soft rice cakes by mixing rice flour with hot water and steaming in molds.
Marinate fish with turmeric and salt; shallow fry and keep aside.
In mustard oil, temper mustard seeds and fry onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, and spices; cook until oil separates.
Add water and fish pieces; simmer till cooked through.
Serve hot fish curry with rice cakes.

title: Prawns Ghugni
instructions: Boil soaked white peas until soft.
Sauté prawns in mustard oil with turmeric and salt, then set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onion and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato and spices; cook until mushy.
Mix in boiled peas and sautéed prawns; simmer together for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Mutton Pakhala
instructions: Soak cooled cooked rice in water and refrigerate overnight to make pakhala.
Boil mutton with salt and turmeric until tender, then fry in mustard oil.
Tempering: heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds, garlic, and chili.
Serve chilled pakhala with hot mutton fry and tempering.

title: Fish Fingers with Bread
instructions: Cut fish into strips and marinate with salt and pepper.
Coat each strip in flour, dip in beaten egg, and roll in breadcrumbs.
Deep-fry until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with bread slices and sauce.

title: Chicken Momos (Steamed)
instructions: Make dough with flour, salt, and water; keep covered for 30 mins.
Mix minced chicken, onion, ginger-garlic paste, chili, and salt.
Roll small dough balls, fill with chicken mix, and shape into momos.
Steam in a greased steamer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve hot with spicy chutney.

title: Khaman Dhokla
instructions: Mix besan, turmeric, sugar, salt, lemon juice, and water into a smooth batter.
Add fruit salt just before steaming and mix gently.
Pour batter into greased plate and steam for 15–20 minutes.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and green chili paste, pour over dhokla.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

title: Handvo
instructions: Soak rice and dals for 4 hours and grind into a coarse batter.
Ferment batter overnight.
Add grated bottle gourd, spices, and salt.
Pour into greased pan, top with mustard and sesame seeds.
Bake or cook covered on stovetop until golden brown.

title: Thepla
instructions: Mix all ingredients to form a soft dough.
Roll into thin discs.
Cook on tawa with oil till both sides are golden.
Serve with curd or pickle.

title: Methi Thepla
instructions: Combine all ingredients and knead into a soft dough.
Roll out and cook each thepla on a hot tawa with oil.
Serve hot with chutney or curd.

title: Fafda
instructions: Mix all ingredients into a stiff dough.
Roll into thin strips using palms.
Deep fry until crisp and golden.
Serve hot with chutney or papaya sambharo.

title: Jalebi-Fafda Combo
instructions: Prepare fafda dough and fry as usual.
Prepare jalebi batter and ferment.
Make sugar syrup with saffron and cardamom.
Fry jalebis and dip in syrup.
Serve hot with fafda.

title: Batata Poha
instructions: Wash and drain poha.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, green chili, turmeric, and potatoes.
Add poha and salt, mix gently.
Cook for a few minutes and garnish with lemon and coriander.

title: Kanda Poha
instructions: Wash and soak poha for 5 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, green chili, onions.
Add turmeric, poha, and salt.
Mix and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with lemon and coriander leaves.

title: Sabudana Khichdi
instructions: Soak sabudana for 4-6 hours and drain.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, chili, peanuts, and potatoes.
Add sabudana and salt, cook till translucent.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Masala Pav
instructions: Heat butter in pan, sauté onions and chili.
Add tomatoes, masala, and salt; cook until soft.
Slice pav and toast on pan with butter.
Fill masala in pav, garnish with coriander, and serve.

title: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: Lemon wedges and chopped coriander for garnish
instructions: Heat butter in a pan, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, capsicum and cook well.
Add boiled potatoes, peas, turmeric, pav bhaji masala, and salt.
Mash everything together while cooking, add water if needed.
Toast pav with butter on a tawa.
Serve bhaji hot with pav, garnished with lemon and coriander.

title: Misal Pav
instructions: Cook sprouted beans with salt and turmeric until soft.
In oil, sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add misal masala and cook until oil separates.
Combine with the cooked beans to make the usal.
Serve hot topped with farsan and coriander, alongside pav.

title: Upma (Maharashtrian)
instructions: Roast semolina until golden and set aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin, curry leaves, and green chili.
Sauté onions, then add water and salt; bring to a boil.
Gradually add semolina, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook until water is absorbed and upma is soft.
Garnish with coriander and lemon juice.

title: Thalipeeth
instructions: Mix bhajani flour with onion, chili, turmeric, and salt.
Add water to form a soft dough.
Pat dough into flat discs on a plastic sheet.
Cook on hot tawa with oil or ghee until golden on both sides.
Serve hot with butter, curd, or chutney.

title: Rava Dhokla
instructions: Mix semolina, curd, water, ginger paste, and salt to make a thick batter.
Let it rest for 15 minutes.
Add Eno and mix gently just before steaming.
Pour into a greased tray and steam for 15–20 minutes.
Temper with mustard, sesame, curry leaves and pour over dhokla.
Cut and serve with chutney.

title: Sev Usal
instructions: Sauté onion and ginger-garlic paste in oil.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft.
Mix in spices and boiled peas.
Simmer until flavors blend well.
Top with sev and coriander before serving.

title: Vada Pav
instructions: Prepare potato masala with mustard seeds, turmeric, and chilies.
Make balls, dip in besan batter, and deep fry until golden.
Slice pav and apply chutney.
Place vada in pav and serve with fried chili.

title: Corn Thepla
instructions: Mix flour with corn, spices, and salt.
Knead into a soft dough.
Roll into thin theplas and cook on tawa with oil.
Serve hot with curd or pickle.

title: Muthiya
instructions: Mix all ingredients and form a dough.
Shape into logs and steam for 20 minutes.
Slice and temper with sesame, curry leaves, and mustard seeds.
Serve with chutney or tea.

title: Kothimbir Vadi
instructions: Mix coriander, besan, chili, ginger, turmeric, and salt with little water.
Steam the batter in a greased tray for 15–20 minutes.
Cool, cut into squares, and shallow fry until crispy.
Serve with chutney or ketchup.
